intro: Scaphochlamys penyamar, commonly known as the Malay false arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its distinctive, arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white spadices surrounded by a showy, hood-like spathe. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
